basics.name: Milad Mesbahi
basics.summary: Masters student in Robotics at the University of Pennsylvania. I recently completed an internship at Blue Origin as a GNC engineer for their engines team, and I am currently researching multi-agent RL in the context of spatiotemporal mapping under Dr. George Pappas. Previous experiences include an internship at NASA JPL, fluid dynamics research at UCLA under Dr. Sungtaek Ju, and co-founding a social networking platform at UCLA that grew to 4000 students. Applying for PhD programs starting Fall 2026.

work.summary: Contributing to control systems analysis and modeling within the Engines team.
highlights: Work is ongoing and governed by proprietary confidentiality

work.summary: Developing multi-agent reinforcement learning frameworks for adaptive salinity mapping with robotic AUVs in highly dynamic coastal environments. Emphasis on spatial-temporal uncertainty reduction, efficient exploration, and coordination under limited sensing and energy constraints.
highlights: Neural network with uncertainty-aware reward design

work.summary: Designed and evaluated chainmail-based damping structures for aerospace vibration mitigation using experimental testing and FEM simulations.
highlights: Achieved up to 98% vibration attenuation with novel mechanical metamaterials
Performed modal analysis and signal processing (MATLAB) across random vibration spectra

work.summary: Led experimental research on how string tension and morphology influence fluid dynamics in liquid desiccant systems. Developed custom image processing tools and designed precise test setups to advance the lab's core research.
highlights: Engineered experimental rigs to study tension effects on bead formation and flow behavior
Built MATLAB image-processing algorithms to automate curvature and fluid flow analysis
Tutorialized the lab setup and tools for future students

work.summary: Founded a student-facing platform focused on building a community at UCLA. Self-directed development in front-end web design, UI/UX, and user growth strategy.
highlights: Built and launched app, continuously going through product iteration cycles. Peaked at 4,000+ active student users

courses: Control and Optimization with Applications in Robotics
